galaxy_dive.analyze_data.simulation_data module¶

Class for analyzing simulation data.

@author: Zach Hafen @contact: zachary.h.hafen@gmail.com @status: Development

Bases: galaxy_dive.analyze_data.generic_data.GenericData

Class for handling simulation data.

add_hubble_flow()[source]¶

Correct for hubble flow movement.

Modifies:
self.data[‘V’] : Accounts for hubble flow, relative to origin
base_data_shape¶

Property for simulation redshift.

calc_radial_distance()[source]¶

Calculate the distance from the origin for a given particle.

center_coords()[source]¶

Change the location of the origin, if the data isn’t already centered.

Modifies:
self.data[‘P’] : Shifts the coordinates to the center.
center_vel_coords()[source]¶

Get velocity coordinates to center on the main halo.

Modifies:
self.data[‘V’] : Makes all velocities relative to self.vel_origin
get_data(data_key, sl=None)[source]¶

Get the data from within the class. Only for getting the data. No post-processing or changing the data (putting it in particular units, etc.) The idea is to calculate necessary quantities as the need arises, hence a whole function for getting the data.

Args:
data_key (str) : Key in the data dictionary for the key we want to get sl (slice) : Slice of the data, if requested.
Returns:
data (np.ndarray) : Requested data.
get_distance_to_point(point)[source]¶

This is not unit tested.

Args:
point (array-like of shape (3,)) : The point you want to find the distance to for each particle.

halo_data¶

Halo data used.

handle_data_key_error(data_key)[source]¶

When get_data() fails to data_key in self.data, it passes the data_key to try and generate that data.

Args:
data_key (str) : Key to try and generate data for
Modifies:
self.data[data_key] (np.array) : If it finds a function to generate the data, it will do so

Calculate the angle (in degrees) from some vector, but don’t mirror it around 90 degrees (e.g. 135 -> 45 degrees, 180 -> 0 degrees).

calc_tangential_velocity()[source]¶

calc_velocity_magnitude()[source]¶

Calculate the radial velocity.

central_mask¶

This mask is used when, for example, finding the velocity of the center of mass.

dN_halo¶

Calculate dN_halo/dX/dlog10Mh or dN_halo/dz/dlog10Mh. X is absorption path length (see for example Ribaudo+11)

time_units: ‘abs_length’- dN_halo/dX/dlog10Mh
‘redshift’ - dN_halo/dz/dlog10Mh
R_vir: None - Default, assumes given.
‘BN’ Calculates R_vir from the mass and redshift

class galaxy_dive.analyze_data.simulation_data.TimeData(data_masker=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: galaxy_dive.analyze_data.simulation_data.SimulationData

Class for analysis of a time series data, e.g. the worldlines of a number of particles.

calc_EnrichedMetalMass()[source]¶

Calculate the metal mass that comes from enrichment, not counting mass that’s at the metallicity floor. Assumes that the there will always be at least one particle in the simulation that’s at the metallicity floor.

calc_MetalMass()[source]¶
calc_abs_phi(normal_vector='total ang momentum')[source]¶

Calculate the angle (in degrees) from some vector, but mirror values past 90 degrees (e.g. 135 -> 45 degrees, 180 -> 0 degrees). This is useful when there’s symmetry above and below 90.

Args:
normal_vector (str or array-like):
Vector that represents the vertical.

calc_time_as_classification(data_key)[source]¶
get_selected_data_over_time(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

get_processed_data(data_key, sl=None, smooth_data=False, smoothing_window_length=9, smoothing_polyorder=3, a_power=None, scale_key=None, scale_a_power=None, scale_h_power=None, tile_data=False, tile_dim='auto', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Modified method for getting processed method. For the most part is equivalent to calling the method of the parent class, but is also capable of scaling the retrieved data by a column from the halo data.

Args:

data_key (str) : What to get out?

sl (slice) : Slice of the data, if requested.

smooth_data (bool) : If True, smooth the data.

smoothing_window_length, smoothing_polyorder (int) :
Arguments for how to smooth the data.
scale_key (str) :
Halo data entry by which to divide the data by.
scale_a_power (float) :
The halo data that we are scaling processed_data by will be multiplied by a to this power. Useful for data in cosmological units (as is often normal).
scale_h_power (float) :
The halo data that we are scaling processed_data by will be multiplied by the hubble parameter to this power. Useful for data in cosmological units (as is often normal).
tile_data (bool) :
If True, tile data along a given direction. This is usually for data formatting purposes.
tile_dim (str) :

If the data is tiled, what dimension of the data should match? Options:

‘auto’ :
Tiles according to data size.
‘match_snaps’ :
The data is tiled such that the new shape is (self.n_snaps, data_size).
‘match_particles’ :
The data is tiled such that the new shape is (data_size, self.n_particles).
*args, **kwargs :
Passed to SimulationData.get_processed_data.
Returns:
processed_data (array-like) : Requested data array.
handle_data_key_error(data_key)[source]¶

When get_data() fails to data_key in self.data, it passes the data_key to try and generate that data.

Args:
data_key (str) : Key to try and generate data for
Modifies:
self.data[data_key] (np.array) : If it finds a function to generate the data, it will do so
